intro: Dalechampia guaranitica, commonly known as the Brazilian fig-leaf tree, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences called cyathia. Its latex sap is milky and can be used in traditional medicine. The species is valued for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitat.
